div.p: A polarization analysis has been performed on the L 1l edge employing a PG-006 analyzer crystal. The aim was to identify dipolar and quadrupolar contributions and to determine the spin direction from the angular dependence.

Because the crystal phase plate was not yet available the measurements had to be done in vertical geometry for u + CT and u + m polarization and in horizontal geometry for K + CT and T + n polarization.

In Figure 3 our original intention was to determine the spin direction from such data. Unfortunately due to experimental problems we did not succeeded in measuring with incident m-polarization. Therefor our refinement of the spin direction did not converge due to a lack of data points. The determination of the spin direction is the last step in the magnetic structure determination for GdS from resonant x-ray diffraction data. Further experiments are planned.

the dependence of the integral intensity on the polarization and the Bragg angle is shown for a a-polarized incident beam. The integral intensity in the o + CT polarization measurement is about 100 times smaller than for u + T polarization. This indicates that the resonance exchange scattering from GdS is dominated by electric dipole transitions to the conduction band. Electric quadruple transitions into the Gd 4f states are negligible.
